citation.article-title: Fulvimonas soli gen. nov., sp. nov., a gamma-proteobacterium isolated from soil after enrichment on acetylated starch plastic.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Fulvimonas (Ful.vi.mo'nas. L. adj. fulvus deep-yellow; Gr. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Fulvimonas deep-yellow monad)
Gram-negative, single rods each about 0.5x2 μm and motile by a single polar flagellum, without spores or capsules.
Grows on acetylated starch, starch, maltose and D-glucose, but assimilates few other substrates.
The cells contain almost exclusively branched fatty acids, with 15:0 iso, 17:1 ω9c iso and 17:0 iso as the main constituents. Fulvimonas belongs to the γ-subclass of the Proteobacteria.
The type species is Fulvimonas soli.
